intro: Cyphostemma boranense, commonly known as the Boran gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in arid and semi-arid regions, often growing on rocky soils. Cyphostemma boranense is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local communities.
